page.title: 07Politics.
page.content: Crail and District Community Council was founded in 1977 and consists of 9 nominated members plus 3 co-opted members, with elections every 3 year. Regional and District Councillors are ex-officio members. Meetings, which are open to the public, held monthly with a representative from each local organisation invited. The purpose of this Council is to ascertain and express, to local and public authorities, the views of the Community in relation to matters for which these authorities are responsible,and to take such action as appears necessary. Finance is allocated from the District Council, augmented by locally raise funds. The Crail amenites Improvement Fund is managed in liaison with local organisations, and the community.
